Commands.Comment:
This Spawned Entity is used within a Entity Script - "holotable - Annotation NPC"
On the Map ID 1 "Archives"
An example off spawning Entities for use within Cutscenes and similar.

This Entity Definition is placed near Interactable Objects (Entities) to display a "?" Annotation above the
Players head, informing them that there is something of interest nearby.

The Script used specificaly for this one is Limited to the Direction North
So the "?" will only appear if the Player is Facing North.

Further more, this Entity will only be Active when the Switch "TouchAnnotation-Switch" is Off, we control that switch within the Message Box Scripts,
as well as in individual Entity Scripts.

This Script Page is to Run when the Player and Entity is Colliding. Using the "Ignore Entity Collision"
and the "Register Ignored Collisions" Options for the Entity, as well as Clipping, to prevent actual Collision.

Using the Save Value Command to find the Direction for use within the Conditionals.
NorthWest = 0
North = 1
NorthEast = 2
East = 3
SouthEast = 4
South = 5
SouthWest = 6
West = 7
The "Save Entity Unique ID" here Saves the Party ID to a Global Variable. To Place and Remove Annotations from the Player.

This Conditional, checks the Switch "TouchAnnotation-Switch", which is used to Prevent the Script from Running when not desired (during Cutscenes)
So when that Switch is Off and the Player is Facing North - It'll place the "?" Above the Player.

As well as turning On a Local Switch, so when you have Multiple Copies of this Entity Definition, they don't interfere with one another.

Using the Save Value Command to find the Direction for use within the Conditional. Using the Player ID (which we Saved Above) for the ID Source.
NorthWest = 0
North = 1
NorthEast = 2
East = 3
SouthEast = 4
South = 5
SouthWest = 6
West = 7
So when the Player is not facing North, the "?" Annotation is Removed.

This Script Page Activates when the Player and Entity is not Colliding, so whenever the Player is not standing
on this Entity, and the Local Switch is On, it'll Remove the "?" Annotation.
Without the Local Switch, and you should have Multiple Copies of this Entity, they will all try to Run at the same time.

Elements.Text: This is a test text, to show the border of the text box, the longer the better. So lets keep this going. Even further shall we.
Elements.Name: Body Element

Commands.Comment: The Switch "TouchAnnotation-Switch" Prevents the Entity Definition Script "Annotation Interaction" from Activating.
This Adds the Annotation to the Actor (NPC or Player) Specified within the Individual Entity Scripts, using the ID we Save.

Note on the "<pause>: 0% Opacity" Text Element:

This one is required for the Display All Virtual Key, to prevent both the DisplayAll and Confirm Key activating at the same time.
It adds the <pause> to the <gv[1]> inside the Text.
This Text need to be "visible" and so needs a normal text displayed, without any <> inbetween.

Thus the Opacity is reduced to 0, making it invisible, while technically still there.
Activates the Switch for the Virtual Key to Display the Message Immediately
Removes the Annotation from the Specified ID (Player Entity etc)
Deactivates the Switch for the Virtual Key to Display the Message Immediately

Commands.Comment: The Switch "TouchAnnotation-Switch" Prevents the Entity Definition Script "Annotation Interaction" from Activating.
This Adds the Annotation to the Actor (NPC or Player) Specified within the Individual Entity Scripts, using the ID we Save.

Note on the "<pause>: 0% Opacity" Text Element:

This one is required for the Display All Virtual Key, to prevent both the DisplayAll and Confirm Key activating at the same time.
It adds the <pause> to the <gv[1]> inside the Text.
This Text need to be "visible" and so needs a normal text displayed, without any <> inbetween.

Thus the Opacity is reduced to 0, making it invisible, while technically still there.
Activates the Switch for the Virtual Key to Display the Message Immediately
Removes the Annotation from the Specified ID (Player Entity etc)
Deactivates the Switch for the Virtual Key to Display the Message Immediately

Elements.Text:
Here you set the Type:
Dialogue - Template for "Display Dialogue Options" Command
Menu - Main/Equip/Item Menu, etc
Message Box - Template for "Display Static Message" Command
Overlay - An Overlay, to display texts, gauges etc.
Shop - Template for the "Open Shop" Command
Elements.Name: Text Element

Commands.Comment: The Switch "TouchAnnotation-Switch" Prevents the Entity Definition Script "Annotation Interaction" from Activating. As well as Removing the "?" Annotation from the Player before it adds its own Annotation.
This Adds the Annotation to the Actor (NPC or Player) Specified within the Individual Entity Scripts, using the ID we Save.

Note on the "<pause>: 0% Opacity" Text Element:

This one is required for the Display All Virtual Key, to prevent both the DisplayAll and Confirm Key activating at the same time.
It adds the <pause> to the <gv[1]> inside the Text.
This Text need to be "visible" and so needs a normal text displayed, without any <> inbetween.

Thus the Opacity is reduced to 0, making it invisible, while technically still there.
Activates the Switch for the Virtual Key to Display the Message Immediately

Removes the Annotation from the Specified ID (Player Entity etc).
And Turns the Switch "TouchAnnotation-Switch" back Off, so the "?" Annotation will reappear when the Current Individual Entity Script is done.
Deactivates the Switch for the Virtual Key to Display the Message Immediately

The Condition for this VK is Activated by a Switch within the User Interface for the Message Boxes.

When Pressed it will add a <pause> Command to the Message Box, and then Display the full Message instantly.
The added <pause> is so when you Press Confirm to Display the Message it doesn't immediately
proceeds to the next Message, but needing an additional Confirm Press to continue.

After it will remove the <pause> Command so when the VK is not pressed, only a single Confirm
is required to proceed.
